title: 115_s2965
content: The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" is the short title of the Act. It enhances the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998. The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" amends the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 by defining 'delete' as removing personal information and making it unlawful for operators to fail to delete information collected from children on the internet. The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" amends the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 by requiring operators to delete personal information collected from children upon request. The Federal Trade Commission will establish regulations for this within a year of the enactment of the act. The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" requires operators to delete personal information collected from children upon request, even if parental consent was given. The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" mandates operators to delete personal information of children upon request from individuals over 13 or their legal guardians, regardless of previous parental consent. Written confirmation of deletion must be provided, except for information needed for judicial processes. The "Clean Slate for Kids Online Act of 2018" requires operators to delete children's personal information upon request, except for information necessary for legal processes. Operators can provide information to law enforcement for public safety investigations but must only retain it for as long as needed for the specified purposes. The Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 is amended to include safe harbors and actions by states, specifying subsections (b) and (e) of section 1303 for compliance.
